fields.value: Global Spatially-Disaggregated Crop Production Statistics Data for 2005 Version 3.2

authorName.value: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)

dsDescriptionValue.value: Using a variety of inputs, IFPRI's Spatial Production Allocation Model (SPAM) uses a cross-entropy approach to make plausible estimates of crop distribution within disaggregated units. Moving the data from coarser units such as countries and sub-national provinces, to finer units such as grid cells, reveals spatial patterns of crop performance, creating a global gridscape at the confluence between geography and agricultural production systems. Improving spatial understanding of crop production systems allows policymakers and donors to better target agricultural and rural development policies and investments, increasing food security and growth with minimal environmental impacts.

publicationCitation.value: Wood-Sichra, U., A.B. Joglekar and L. You. 2016. “Spatial Production Allocation Model (SPAM) 2005: Technical Documentation”. HarvestChoice Working Paper. Washington, D.C.: International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) and St. Paul: International Science and Technology Practice and Policy (InSTePP) Center, University of Minnesota.

fields.value: For more information and data download options, please visit the MapSPAM website at http://mapspam.info. This work was undertaken as part of the CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM) led by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI). Funding support was provided by PIM and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

producerName.value: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)

contributorName.value: CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM)
U.S. Agency for International Development - Bureau for Food Security

files.description: Concordance table of the primary key in SPAM data tables and its centroid coordinates in CSV format. Col_row: Column number and row number separated by “ – “ of SPAM’s numbering of pixels (which yields then alloc_key), X: X coordinate of centroid of pixel (longitude), Y: Y coordinate of centroid of pixel (latitude), Alloc_key: Concatenation of row and col from first field but turned around and each with leading 0’s to give 4 characters, Hc_seq5m: CELL5M ID (See https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/MZLXVQ) for more details).
files.label: cell5m_allockey_xy.csv.zip
